metadata.titel_preek: Thyatira, Part II: The Great Possibility

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher connects the letter to Thyatira with Palm Sunday, focusing on the theme of human freedom ('The Great If') and God's campaign to win back humanity.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. Uses historical-narrative links and personal anecdote rather than deep textual exegesis of the Apocalypse.

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is an appeal to the human will (Directive) framed within a description of potentiality (Assertive).
voorbeelden: Look! Man, woman, your relation to God is in your hand.
Be done with the notion 'I can't.' You can!
If you will open your spirit to him, he will guide your footsteps.

perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is mentioned as a guide, but the focus is on the human 'if'.

voorbeelden: Thyatira is hundreds of miles from Jerusalem.
God cannot do anything about consequence.
Be done with the notion 'I can't'.
I shudder when I read the account.
I say particularly to these young people...
I will give him the morning star (quoted from text).
commissieven.kwaliteit: Conditional. Most promises are 'If-Then' structures, placing the burden on the hearer's initiation.

declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher acts more as a witness/exhorter than a mandatory pronouncing absolution.

indicatoren: Historical descriptions of Moses and Solomon.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is informed about their own power, but not necessarily 'happened upon' by God's word.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer feels the weight of the 'If' rather than the rest of the 'Done'.

voorbeelden: If you will open your spirit to him, he will guide your footsteps.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes (Oberlin) and homiletical framing ('I say').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct appeal to the will ('You can').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used for exhortation more than sacramental promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing God, Moses, Solomon, and 'the dog'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the first half.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about human nature and 'The If'.

actueel_present.gebruik: The climactic appeal at the end.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God's campaign) -> Directive (Your 'If') -> Conditional Commissive (He will if you do).
voorbeelden: Your relation to God is in your hand... so put God in your life.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative (Directive) is not founded on a finished work (Declarative), but on a human possibility.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Lacks the unconditional 'Because Christ has... I declare to you...'

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The power is in your hands... No, the power is in your hands.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: While rhetorically powerful and 'evangelical' in tone, the illocutionary structure is semi-Pelagian: it centers on the human 'If' as the hinge of the event.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God can do anything but fail, yes he can!

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: If you will offer yourself... the Lord will bless your life.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Makes God's action dependent on human initiation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a rhetorical event, but the sacramental 'happening' is hindered by the focus on human capacity.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher speaks *about* the possibility of God rather than *delivering* God.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is mostly the object of description, not the active subject of the speech act.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as an encourager/witness rather than a mandatory.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is attributed to the human 'If' and 'will' more than the Spirit's sovereign work.
tekstueel_bewijs: The power is in your hands.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as an 'appeal' rather than a 'means'.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'You can' (Directive) to 'Christ has' (Assertive/Declarative) and 'I give you' (Commissive).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: If you will ask him to give you strength, he will give you strength.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Receive now the strength of the Morning Star which Christ here bestows upon you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a conditional future to a present sacramental gift.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Proclaim the promise as the ground of the 'If', not the result of it.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ is the Morning Star, you are no longer in the dark.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'He' (God) as the subject of active verbs addressing 'You'.
voorbeeldzinnen: God is winning you back right now.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'Overcome!' lacks the indicative 'You are forgiven/empowered'.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Start with the Declarative of what God has done in Thyatira/Palm Sunday.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has immense rhetorical power and personal warmth, but it risks becoming a lecture on human potential. By grounding the 'If' in the 'Done' of the Cross, the sermon will move from an appeal to an event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'Self-Revelation' (Oberlin story); SAT reveals that this story functions as an Assertive that lacks Declarative authority.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the 'If' is a powerful trope; homiletically, it creates a 'Constative Surplus' that delays the encounter.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that 'You can' is a Directive that, without a prior Commissive, becomes a new Law.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The power is in your hands.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Exhortative Preaching' where the performative weight is placed on the hearer's response rather than God's address.
